conclusion: Determine electric field strength at the intersection of diagonals of square with charges at vertices.
Charges +q at A and B, -q at C and D on square vertices.
Coordinates of vertices: A = (0, L/2), B = (L, L/2), C = (L, -L/2), D = (0, -L/2).
Intersection of diagonals is at center of square: (L/2, 0).
Calculate electric field due to +q at A: position vector r_A = (L/2, -L/2).
Electric field due to +q at A: E_A = k_e q/(L^2 sqrt(2)) (1, -1).
Calculate electric field due to +q at B: position vector r_B = (-L/2, -L/2).
Electric field due to +q at B: E_B = k_e q/(L^2 sqrt(2)) (-1, -1).
Calculate electric field due to -q at C: position vector r_C = (-L/2, L/2).
